page.title: 06A TYPICAL LOCAL FARM
page.content:
is on a Thursday and Huddersfield market is on a Monday. The average cow gives 5 gallons a day. The average daily herd is approximately 400 gallons. It is collected daily by the Milk Market Board, who take it to the depot, clean and bottle it, and sell it. (Most of the milk in this area is unpasteurized and some farms bottle their own milk and sell it direct to the public or to a local milk round.)
Mr Hirst finds that the main problem affecting his farming is the weather, which can be severe in this area. He occasionally has to call in the local vet; the principal problem with the livestock being pneumonia. Two farm workers are employed on the farm. Mr Hirst has quite a lot of valuable farm machinery, including 6 tractors.
